item.title: 98 Brondesbury Villas, 10th November
item.description:
Refuse bags full of leaves left by the tree, someone taking it into their own hands to sweep the pavement. As you can see form the photo this part of the street has not been swept for leaves for weeks and is now covered in wet leaves which are covering the pavement and causing a hazard. Please can the pavement also be swept for leaves as it is becoming dangerous

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Villas, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant dog fouling, 10th November
item.description:
Dog fouling - the pavement is absolutely covered with dog excrement. There are one or two dogs walked regularly where I have seen the owner fail to pick up. Not only is there zero enforcement, but no attempt by the council to keep the streets clean.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van left abandoned for 3 months no MOT, 10th November
item.description:
This van has been parked in Ambleside Road for 3 months with no MOT. You closed the original ticket we raised (8385482) for whatever reason so the police suggested we raise another ticket to make you aware of the situation

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, Long Lane, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous puddle for pedestrians, 10th November
item.description:
Hi, This pothole has been here since we opened the shop in 2014. We tried to alert many times at the time. I’m gonna try again as it’s extremely dangerous for old people, wheelchairs and clearly anyone when it’s raining. We always clear the water but it should be fixed. So many accidents had happened already. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Trees, 10th November
item.description:
I live in number 42 Haddon Grove, Sidcup right opposite Hollyoak Park, Cedar Avenue which is lined with many huge large trees including big oak trees.. Over the last year with the increasing amount of extreme windy days the trees have been bending more and more and I am very concerned that they will cause damage to my property especially to my roof and garden. These trees have not been pruned or pollarded since I have lived and I have lived here 18 years next week. I would greatly appreciate a response as this is not the first I have brought this tree issue to the councils attention. I look forward to hearing from you. Mrs V Tipping Valerietipping@icloud.com
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedar Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
